intro: Wahlenbergia capillacea, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It has slender, hairless stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Wahlenbergia capillacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and coastal landscapes.
